channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Spring 2025 Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description: Date: Monday, April 14, 2025 (all day) - Spring 2025 student course evaluations are now open. The evaluation period is from 4/11 through 4/24. Your feedback is very important to the Institute, the five schools, and their departments, so please complete evaluation surveys for all your courses! Evaluations will be available through Thursday, April 24, 2025.
item.author: Students

item.title: Grow Your Future | April 23
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 23, 2025 11:00 AM - 1:00 PM - Grow Your Future: A celebration for First-Year Students! A bridge between the end of your First-Year Experience to your Sophomore Experience, we hope you will join us on Wednesday, April 23 from 11 a.m.-1 p.m. outside Commons Dining Hall. Students can check in with support services and grab some ice cream and swag!
item.author: Students

item.title: SaaS in the Age of Generative AI – Navigating the Boom (Virtual) | April 22
item.description: Date: Tuesday, April 22, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - In this webinar, Sarabeth Jaffe ’15 a Forbes 30 Under 30 entrepreneur and Shark Tank-backed founder shares her journey from software engineer to startup founder, offering insights into launching a startup in 2025, future-proofing SaaS products, and navigating the AI rat race without burning out.
item.author: Community

item.title: Money-Saving Car Shopping Virtual Workshop | April 23
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 23, 2025 7:00 PM - 8:30 PM - Our fourth in a series of automobile-related webinars will show you how to use online tools to find the best cars that fit your budget and needs with focus around buying used cars. This event will be presented by John M. Sun ’87, former Research and Marketing Manager of JATO Dynamics LTD, a global automotive market intelligence company.
item.author: Community

item.title: Design Lab Showcase to be held Wednesday, April 23rd from 2:00 - 5:00 P.M.
item.description: The Design Showcase will be held on Wednesday, April 23, 2025 from 2:00 to 5:00 p.m. in the DCC Great Hall. Students from multiple engineering disciplines (Computer & Systems, Electrical, Industrial & Management, Materials and Mechanical Engineering) solve real-world design challenges for industry, entrepreneurs and academic/medical partners. Visit the showcase to: Interact with project teams and view their achievements Learn how students solve complex design challenges Get inspired by…
item.author: Community

item.title: Poster Session open to RPI Community | April 22
item.description: Date: Tuesday, April 22, 2025 4:00 PM - 6:00 PM - The RPI community is invited to attend a poster session for the pilot sections of Introduction to Engineering Design (IED-2050) on Tuesday, April 22nd from 4-6 pm in the 2nd floor lobby of JEC.
item.author: Community

item.title: iEAR Presents! Heightened Scrutiny Film Screening and Q&A
item.description: Heightened Scrutiny is a documentary film about the first out trans attorney arguing in front of the US Supreme Court (United States v. Skrmetti) and the role of mainstream media in fueling anti-trans legislation. The film’s director, Sam Feder, will be presenting this film at the Sanctuary followed by a Q&A. Ahead of the film, Feder will be offering a Be The Media! workshop from 5-6pm.
item.author: Community

item.title: RPI Researchers Receive Prestigious Gordon Prize from National Academy of Engineering
item.description: Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute’s Georges Belfort, Ph.D., and Steven Cramer, Ph.D., both Institute Professors of Chemical and Biological Engineering, have won the 2025 Bernard M. Gordon Prize for Innovation in Engineering and Technology Education given by the National Academy of Engineering.
item.author: Community

item.title: TIAA Confidential Counseling (In-Person) | April 23
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 23, 2025 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM - A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. Attend this upcoming event to help you become better informed and more confident about Rensselaer’s retirement plan benefits. Consultations will be conducted in 60 minute increments. To schedule your individual retirement counseling, please call TIAA at 1-800-732-8353 or online at https://shared.tiaa.org/public/publictools/events…
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Did They Get It: Designing Meaningful Assessments | April 23
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, April 23, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:30 PM - This series, Helping Students Learn, focuses on research-based teaching theories and methods. It is funded by NSF as part of the MANE RED grant. Each session is led by Eric Burkholder (Auburn University, Engineering Education Researcher). Participants will be able to apply research from cognitive psychology directly to their instructional approach to promote student learning and success. The topic of Session 3 is “Did They Get It? Designing…

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
